meanings.definition: To make someone unconscious or insensible with drugs.
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to narcotize the patient before the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The medication will narcotize you, so you won't feel any pain.
meanings.sent3: After taking the sleeping pill, he joked that it could narcotize an elephant!
meanings.sent4: The peaceful music seemed to narcotize her worries away.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic effect of the drug slowly narcotized his mind.

meanings.definition: To dull or deaden the senses or feelings.
meanings.sent1: The strong painkiller will narcotize the pain in no time.
meanings.sent2: The monotonous task seemed to narcotize his enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The boring lecture threatened to narcotize the entire audience.
meanings.sent4: The gray sky seemed to narcotize the vibrant colors of the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the clock began to narcotize her mind.
